text: Who wrote the Epistle to Titus?
verseText: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, for the sake of the faith of God's elect and their knowledge of the truth, which accords with godliness,

text: To whom is the letter addressed?
options: Titus, Paul's 'true child in a common faith'
verseText: To Titus, my true child in a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.

text: Where had Paul left Titus to carry out his ministry?
verseText: This is why I left you in Crete, so that you might put what remained into order, and appoint elders in every town as I directed you—

text: What was one of the main tasks Paul instructed Titus to do in Crete?
verseText: This is why I left you in Crete, so that you might put what remained into order, and appoint elders in every town as I directed you—

text: Similar to 1 Timothy, Titus 1 lists qualifications for which church office?
verseText: if anyone is above reproach, the husband of one wife, and his children are believers and not open to the charge of debauchery or insubordination. For an overseer, as God's steward, must be above reproach...

text: How did Paul generally characterize the people of Crete, quoting one of their own prophets (Titus 1)?
options: 'Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons'
verseText: One of the Cretans, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”

text: In Titus 2, Paul instructs Titus to teach sound doctrine appropriate for different groups. What should older women teach the younger women?
options: To love their husbands and children, to be self-controlled, pure, working at home, kind, and submissive to their own husbands
verseText: Older women likewise are to be reverent in behavior... They are to teach what is good, and so train the young women to love their husbands and children, to be self-controlled, pure, working at home, kind, and submissive to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be reviled.

text: What does Titus 2:11 say has appeared, bringing salvation for all people?
verseText: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation for all people,

text: According to Titus 3:5, God saved believers not because of righteous things they had done, but because of what?
verseText: he saved us, not because of works done by us in righteousness, but according to his own mercy, by the washing of regeneration and renewal of the Holy Spirit,

text: What does Paul instruct Titus to do regarding a person who stirs up division after a first and second warning?
options: Have nothing more to do with them
verseText: As for a person who stirs up division, after warning him once and then twice, have nothing more to do with him,

text: According to Paul's description, what must an elder/overseer hold firmly to?
verseText: He must hold firm to the trustworthy word as taught, so that he may be able to give instruction in sound doctrine and also to rebuke those who contradict it.

text: Why must elders be able to rebuke those who contradict sound doctrine?
options: Because there are many rebellious people, empty talkers, and deceivers
To maintain control over the church
verseText: ...so that he may be able to give instruction in sound doctrine and also to rebuke those who contradict it. For there are many who are insubordinate, empty talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision party.

text: Paul mentions a specific group causing trouble in Crete, known as the 'circumcision party'. What were they likely teaching?
options: That Gentiles must follow Jewish customs/law to be saved
That believers should withdraw from society
That grace allows for sinful living
That Paul was not a true apostle
verseText: For there are many who are insubordinate, empty talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision party. They must be silenced, since they are upsetting whole families by teaching for shameful gain what they ought not to teach... not devoting themselves to Jewish myths and the commands of people who turn away from the truth.

text: What does Paul say about those who claim to know God but deny him by their works?
options: They are detestable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work
verseText: They profess to know God, but they deny him by their works. They are detestable, disobedient, unfit for any good work.

text: What quality should characterize older men, according to Paul's instruction to Titus?
options: Sober-minded, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, and in steadfastness
verseText: Older men are to be sober-minded, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, and in steadfastness.

text: Besides teaching younger women, what behavior should characterize older women?
options: Reverent in behavior, not slanderers or slaves to much wine
verseText: Older women likewise are to be reverent in behavior, not slanderers or slaves to much wine. They are to teach what is good,

text: What is the reason given for why younger women should live according to Paul's instructions?
options: So their husbands will be pleased
So that the word of God may not be reviled
So they can manage their homes efficiently
verseText: ...to be self-controlled, pure, working at home, kind, and submissive to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be reviled.

text: How should Titus encourage younger men?
verseText: Likewise, urge the younger men to be self-controlled.

text: How was Titus himself supposed to act as an example?
options: By showing integrity, dignity, and sound speech
verseText: Show yourself in all respects to be a model of good works, and in your teaching show integrity, dignity, and sound speech that cannot be condemned...

text: What instructions did Paul give regarding bondservants (slaves)?
options: To be submissive, well-pleasing, not argumentative, not pilfering, showing good faith
To work only for Christian masters
verseText: Bondservants are to be submissive to their own masters in everything; they are to be well-pleasing, not argumentative, not pilfering, but showing all good faith...

text: What is the ultimate purpose for the good conduct of bondservants?
options: To gain favor with their masters
To adorn the doctrine of God our Savior
verseText: ...showing all good faith, so that in everything they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior.

text: What does the grace of God train believers to do?
options: Renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives
verseText: training us to renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age,

text: What blessed hope are believers waiting for?
options: The appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ
verseText: waiting for our blessed hope, the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ,

text: Why did Jesus give himself for us, according to Titus?
options: To redeem us from lawlessness and purify for himself a people for his own possession
verseText: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all lawlessness and to purify for himself a people for his own possession who are zealous for good works.

text: What characteristic should mark the people Jesus purified for himself?
verseText: ...to purify for himself a people for his own possession who are zealous for good works.

text: How should believers relate to rulers and authorities?
options: Be submissive, obedient, and ready for every good work
verseText: Remind them to be submissive to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,

text: Besides submitting to authorities, how should believers generally behave towards all people?
options: Speak evil of no one, avoid quarreling, be gentle, show perfect courtesy
verseText: to speak evil of no one, to avoid quarreling, to be gentle, and to show perfect courtesy toward all people.

text: Paul reminds Titus that believers themselves were once what?
options: Foolish, disobedient, led astray, slaves to passions, living in malice and envy, hated by others
verseText: For we ourselves were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, slaves to various passions and pleasures, passing our days in malice and envy, hated by others and hating one another.

text: What appeared that led to the salvation of believers?
options: The goodness and loving kindness of God our Savior
verseText: But when the goodness and loving kindness of God our Savior appeared,

text: Salvation comes through the 'washing of regeneration and renewal'. What agent brings about this renewal?
verseText: he saved us... by the washing of regeneration and renewal of the Holy Spirit,

text: How was the Holy Spirit given to believers?
options: Poured out richly through Jesus Christ our Savior
verseText: whom he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior,

text: Having been justified by grace, what do believers become?
options: Heirs according to the hope of eternal life
verseText: so that being justified by his grace we might become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

text: Paul wants Titus to insist on certain truths so that believers will be careful to do what?
verseText: The saying is trustworthy, and I want you to insist on these things, so that those who have believed in God may be careful to devote themselves to good works.

text: What kinds of discussions should Titus avoid?
options: Foolish controversies, genealogies, dissensions, and quarrels about the law
verseText: But avoid foolish controversies, genealogies, dissensions, and quarrels about the law, for they are unprofitable and worthless.

text: Why should divisive people be avoided after two warnings?
options: Because they are warped and sinful; self-condemned
Because they might win the argument
verseText: knowing that such a person is warped and sinful; he is self-condemned.

text: Who did Paul plan to send to Titus, after which Titus should hurry to meet Paul?
verseText: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.

text: Where had Paul decided to spend the winter?
verseText: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.

text: Which two individuals does Paul specifically ask Titus to help on their journey?
verseText: Do your best to speed Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way; see that they lack nothing.

text: Paul encourages believers to learn to devote themselves to good works for what practical reason?
options: To help cases of urgent need and not be unfruitful
verseText: And let our people learn to devote themselves to good works, so as to help cases of urgent need, and not be unfruitful.

text: What is Paul's final greeting to Titus?
verseText: All who are with me send greetings to you. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all.
